instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00850 20V not booting
threads.message:
Clean board, no history.

Testing without battery and only charger connected:

20V and 0.030-0.170A on charger 
12.6V on PPBUS for about 20 seconds then drops to 12.3V for about 2 seconds then repeats.
AWAKE and SLPS2R signals present but they restart as well around 20 seconds.
SSD voltages present

Restoring T2 gives error: Gave up waiting for device to transition from RestoreOS state to BootedOS state

threads.title: 820-00850 20V not booting
threads.message:
Try DFU with both charger and (known good) battery connected.
Also try it disconnecting internal LCD; use external monitor for test.

threads.title: 820-00850 20V not booting
threads.message: Restoring the T2 instead of reviving it did the trick, I also had better luck restoring with 10.15.7 than any other OS.

threads.title: 820-00850 20V not booting
threads.message:
Thanks for feedback solution.
We need to collect as much as possible information about T2 machines.
Geting stuck in DFU make us thinking on other problems than firmware corruption.
Apple did "great job" on new machines...
